instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .
definitions.PP5V_S4: What is PP5V_S4? PP5V_S4 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.PP1V2_S3: What is PP1V2_S3? PP1V2_S3 is a 1.2v power rail present when the machine is in an S3 suspend to RAM state.
definitions.PPVCCIO_S0_CPU: What is PPVCCIO_S0_CPU? PPVCCIO_S0_CPU is a power rail responsible for powering the part of the CPU responsible for communicating with other portions of the machine prior to PPVCORE_S0_CPU being present and must be present before vcore, PPVCCIO_S0_CPU is present when the machine is in an on, RUNNING state. .
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
this board turns on fan without video, hot cpu,
amp=19v 2.9A
this measure

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>=9.7v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>=3.3v

PPVCCEDRAM_S0_REG_R=1.05
<SIGNAL>PPVCCGT_CPU_PH1</SIGNAL>=0v
<SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>=1.05
PPVCCPRIMCORE_SUS_PCH=1v
<SIGNAL>PP1V0_SUS</SIGNAL>=1v
<SIGNAL>PP1V2_S3</SIGNAL>   =1.2
<SIGNAL>PPVCCIO_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> =0.97

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>=1.05"
It should drop to 0.65V, when board really boots.

Any history available?
You can try to flash known good BIOS.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Could you give me a BIOS in good condition, chip rom is <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>  is true?
Any history available? algo de pelusa sobre <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> como se ve en la foto, ya limpie pero persiste problema con camara termica calienta <CHIP>U7210</CHIP>,l7030 despues de un tiempo
